benchmark_details.name: Multi-OphthaLingua
benchmark_details.overview: This study introduces the first multilingual ophthalmological question-answering benchmark with manually curated questions parallel across languages, allowing for direct cross-lingual comparisons.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess and debias LLM ophthalmological question-answering in multilingual contexts, facilitating equitable LLM application across different languages.

data.source: The data was curated by board-certified ophthalmologists from diverse language backgrounds.
data.annotation: Manually curated and reviewed by native-speaker ophthalmologists.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated by measuring the proportion of correct answers in the question-answering tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance of LLMs in understanding and responding to the ophthalmology-related questions.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 and GPT-3.5 accuracy results vary significantly, with GPT-4 achieving 63.4% in English and 51.8% in Filipino.
